args:
At last, the truth is revealed: The one pulling the
strings was the girl left behind in the village,
Lathnaâ€”or, more specifically, Nyarlathotep.
In order to lay bare the secrets of the spell that
can bring about the end of this creeping chaos,
the party rushes off to gather information.
Curran? What's wrong? I thought you\nwere going back to check on Lathna.
You should get back there right now!\nI found this note in the castle!
Uh oh. Let me see that.
A black shadow is in my dreams.\nA black shadow seeks my life.\nI must learn if it is real.
I must know if Nyarlathotep will kill me.
Are you saying that poor girl went back\nto that horrid library by herself?!
Yes, and we need to find her.
Look, there's someone on the ground!
Stand back, please. I will help her.
Lathna, are you okay? What happened?
I knew that dragon was dangerous!
If that's true, we need to track him down\nand figure out what's really going on.
It has the spell...to defeat Nyarlathotep...
Nyarlathotep...said... If spell is cast...\nhe would disappear...
Are we certain this information\ncan be trusted?
Well, magic books are a job for Heinwald,\nso let's... Huh? Where'd he go?
Now that you mention it, I've not seen\nhim since we entered the library.
Just when we need him the most.\nWhat's going on with that egghead?!
Well, until he returns, I have at least\nsome knowledge in these realms.\nLet me take a look at the tome.
Hmm... Yes, it seems this book has a spell\nof ï¼‚sealing the wickedï¼‚ inscribed within.
Would that be enough to seal away\nNyarlathotep?
I would not recommend thatâ€”unless you\nwish to become books yourselves, that is.
Because I knew we could not have a quiet,\nproductive conversation with you around.
You had a CONVERSATION with him?\nWhat exactly are you scheming here?!
I scheme nothing more than to ascertain\nthe truth of our situation.
Heinwald, what did you mean when you\nsaid we'd be turned into books?
Exactly that. If you cast the spell within\nthat book, it is likely everyone here\nwould be transformed into a tome.
But the book said that spell would\nseal away the wicked!

This is the Library Obscuraâ€”home to every
taboo and forbidden thing. It is folly to
assume that its judgment of what is good
or wicked is the same as ours.
Indeed, you should be much more\nconcerned about that thing over there\nwhich masquerades as a girl.
That girl is the cause of all of this.\nOr, to be more precise, the thing that\nhas assumed her form is the cause.
That Lathna is not a girl of Hethiwood,\njust as this Nyarlathotep is not the one\nwho guided the village to ruin.
The ritual mentioned in the priest's diary\nis what transformed the villagers.
The diary claimed an ï¼‚emissaryï¼‚ named\nNyarlathotep encouraged and guided\nthem during said ritual.
And yet you would stand at his side\nwhen you should work to defeat him!
Ah, but THIS Nyarlathotep had nothing\nto do with the ritual.
How could he have been involved when\nhe was sealed away in this very library?
Wait. Nyarlathotep said something about\nnot having just one name or form, right?\nWhich would mean... Oh no.

Your memory serves you well.
But yes, it means there is a being
OTHER than the being before us
that is also called Nyarlathotep.
And you think this being is Lathna?\nHow can you be certain?!
Think carefully. The people of Hethiwood\nwere 209 souls in totalâ€”including Lathna\nand the slaughtered priest.
I thought the same at first.\nBut we found the priest's BODY.
He was not transformed into a book,\nwhich means we are still one short.
Every villager was turned into a book, yes?
So if only the priest was not transformed,\nwe should have 208 books.
But Lathna ALSO wasn't transformed,\nwhich means we should have 207.\nBut...we don't. We have 208.
We know there was a girl named Lathna\nin the village, correct?
Yeah, I saw her name in the register.
Then there remains one possibility:\nThe actual Lathna has been transformed,\nand the Lathna before us is a fake.
The Lathna before us is the Emissary\nspoken of by the villagersâ€”but in a\nchanged form.
...That is to say, she is Nyarlathotep!
You changed your form to trick us and\noffer us as sacrifices to the Ancient One,\ndidn't you, Lathna?!
Friend? The only thing that's a\nfriend to me is the truth.
I thought it was strange when you said\nyou were attacked by Nyarlathotep.
How could a little village girl escape\na dragon attack with only the simple\nwounds you seem to carry?
Now that you say it, something did\nfeel strange when I was healing her.
And Nyarlathotep didn't even steal the\ngrimoire from youâ€”the very grimoire\nthat supposedly spells his doom.
There's only one answer to this:\nYou WEREN'T attacked by Nyarlathotep!
You've been trying to trick us,\njust like Heinwald said!
Now, what name shall we use for you?\nLathna? Nyarlathotep? Or, perhaps,\nthe Emissary of Salvation?
Enough of this! Return the villagers\nto their true forms at once!
The sweetest sacrifice is the insect\nwho willingly seeks flame.
O, Ancient One, forgive my inefficacy!\nAmnesty! Amnesty! Amnesty!
You reside in the nest of offerings.\nThe library of the Ancient One.\nYou shall be given unto It.
And here we have our enemy at last.\nBut now that we're here, I wonder whose\nside the library Nyarlathotep is on?
We are Chaos. Chaos is freedom.\nWe concede no succor to the Emissary.
...You. Does your duty to the\nAncient One lie abandoned?
As Emissary, I am Chaos.\nMy desire. Your desire. Master's desire.\nThey overlap, but are not one.
I'm going to assume that means he's\nnot our enemy. ...Well, that and the\nfact he isn't attacking us or whatever.
The dragon has his own aims,\nbut he is no foe of ours.
In that case, we only have one foe\nleft to deal with...
The Emissary's life is null. Thus, infinite.\nIt exists outside the realm of being.
The infinity of zero... Ah, yes. I see.\nJust as one cannot kill what is dead,\nwe cannot defeat Nyarlathotep.
And yet we cannot leave such\na dangerous being unchecked!
There is one option: I have obtained a\ngrimoire with a spell that can annihilate\nNyarlathotep from this world.
And WHEN were you going to\ntell us about this?!
Alas, the tome is dense indeed,\nand I am still trying to parse it.
We'll head out and get Heinwald whatever\nhe needs to decipher that grimoire.
There is no escape. No egress.

Thou awakened the closed casket!
Thou tread upon the cellar floor!
Thou shalt adorn the Ancient One's
dining table and provide It sustenance!
